summary: This appears to be an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sharing a draft Q&A document (likely for witness preparation or examination) and referencing a '3500' material disclosure related to a witness ('Her'). The document is part of the Epstein case files.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email, working in the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, sharing a draft Q&A document and referencing witness materials.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York (United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY was preparing a Q&A document, likely for witness examination, in November 2021.
The correspondence references 'Her 3500', indicating the disclosure of Jencks Act / Rule 3500 materials for a female witness.
The email includes a draft document titled 'Direct Examination v2.docx' with cross-examination thoughts, suggesting active trial or deposition preparation.
